function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Non-peer-reviewed manuscripts included in the analysis"},{"name":"Failure to consider migration patterns and isolation policies in the studies"},{"name":"Uncertainty and limitations in understanding the impact of climatic variables on the spread of covid-19"},{"name":"Population density contributing to faster spread of the virus"},{"name":"Underreporting of new cases of covid-19"},{"name":"Lack of peer review for included studies in the systematic review"},{"name":"Cold air causing vasoconstriction of the respiratory tract and weakening of the immune system"},{"name":"Dry cold air making the nasal mucosa prone to small ruptures, creating opportunities for virus invasion"},{"name":"Low or extremely cold temperature playing a positive role in reducing the transmission of coronavirus"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 in tropical climates due to heat intolerance of the virus and breakdown of lipid bilayer"},{"name":"Seasonality and environmental influences on the spread of respiratory pathogens"},{"name":"Increased viral stability and reproduction in cold temperatures"},{"name":"Lack of public health interventions associated with certain humidity and temperature conditions"},{"name":"Suitable temperature and humidity range for the survival and transmission of covid-19"},{"name":"Lack of characterization of exact local temperature and humidity conditions"},{"name":"Confounding variables not identified in some studies"},{"name":"Use of simple correlation in statistical analysis"},{"name":"Complex relationship between social and meteorological factors in coronavirus outbreaks"},{"name":"Limitations in the identification of confounding factors impacting the final analysis of included articles"},{"name":"Use of secondary data due to the urgency of the global situation with the rapid spread of covid-19"},{"name":"Extrapolation of results from studies conducted before the outbreak to the spread characteristics of covid-19 worldwide"},{"name":"Methodological issues identified in the systematic review."},{"name":"High risk of bias in two studies investigating the effect of humidity on the transmission of sars-cov-2."},{"name":"Moderate and low risk of bias in certain studies investigating the effect of humidity on the transmission of sars-cov-2."},{"name":"Low certainty of evidence in studies on the association between temperature and humidity with the spread rate of covid-19"},{"name":"Observational studies with inherent risk of bias in the assessment of climate variables"},{"name":"Homogeneity of results among the included studies"},{"name":"Unreviewed articles"},{"name":"Confounding variables impact on disease spread"},{"name":"Risk of bias in included studies"},{"name":"Homogeneity in the effect of temperature and humidity on the seasonal variability and spread of the virus"},{"name":"Inadequate statistical analysis compromising conclusions about the effect of temperature and humidity on virus spread"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the impact of meteorological factors on epidemic trends"},{"name":"Retrospective observational studies associating weather variables with the spread of covid-19"},{"name":"Heterogeneity in weather conditions beyond temperature and humidity"},{"name":"Heterogeneity in data collection dates and locations"},{"name":"Possible inclusion of biased studies in the search results."},{"name":"Misinterpretation of study outcomes due to varying levels of evidence."},{"name":"Failure to address potential conflicts and bias during study selection and evaluation."},{"name":"Systematic review on the emergence and replicability of the virus and its association with weather factors"},{"name":"Limited studies on the influence of climate parameters on the spread of sars-cov-2"},{"name":"Coronavirus can retain infectivity in low temperature and low humidity environment for up to 2 weeks"},{"name":"Divergence in literature about the effects of temperature and humidity on the viability and transmissibility of the coronavirus"},{"name":"High transmissibility of sars-cov-2"},{"name":"Unclear routes of virus transmission"},{"name":"Impact of population density and migratory flow on transmission"},{"name":"Retailers not using digital signs to present covid information"},{"name":"Fragility of paper signs reflecting uncertainty during pandemic"},{"name":"Retailers not demonstrating corporate social responsibility through signage"},{"name":"Lack of communication with retailers about posted signs"}]}
